author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Sub-Court here on Tuesday awarded seven years’ rigorous imprisonment to A. Gavaskar (26) of Madurai district in a robbery case reported under Virudhunagar Bazaar police station limits in 2011.

According to prosecution, the accused snatched a 10-sovereign gold chain from a 50-year-old woman, Rajajayanthi, when she was walking in Andi Kinattru Street on August 23, 2011. As the woman raised an alarm, a passer-by, P. Murugan (43), tried to intercept him, Additional Public Prosecutor K. Ramdhas said.

However, the accused stabbed him on his abdomen and hand, and fled on a motorbike. Virudhunagar Bazaar police had registered a case and subsequently nabbed the accused. When the case came up for hearing, Sub-Judge M.E. Padma awarded seven-year jail term to the accused and imposed a fine of Rs. 1,000 on him, failing to pay which he would have to undergo an additional six months’ imprisonment.
title: Robbery: seven-year jail term for youth
